title: Shared Execution System
description: A system designed to provide scalable, high-performance transaction processing across blockchain ecosystems.
details: Altius offers parallel transaction execution for Layer 1s and Layer 2s on a pay-for-use basis, enabling chains to offload transaction processing to increase throughput and reduce costs.

title: Open Execution Network
description: A decentralized execution model that allows any entity to participate in transaction processing without permission.
details: Executors contribute computational resources and stake tokens to execute transactions. The network eliminates central authority, ensuring a decentralized and resilient execution infrastructure.

title: Decentralized Execution Infrastructure
description: A system where independent participants (Executors) execute transactions and smart contracts across various chains.
details: Executors stake both Altius' native tokens and the native tokens of target chains to compete for execution tasks, ensuring network reliability and integrity.

title: Security and Accountability
description: A mechanism to ensure integrity in the execution process through incentives and penalties.
details: Executors who fail to perform duties honestly, manipulate results, or provide incorrect execution face slashing of their staked tokens, promoting high-quality execution and discouraging malicious behavior.

title: Permissionless Participation
description: An open-access model allowing anyone with resources to join the network and offer execution services.
details: No central authority controls access, ensuring diverse participation, fostering decentralization, and enhancing blockchain scalability.

title: Scalability
description: A key benefit of the Open Execution Network, allowing for increased blockchain transaction throughput.
details: Parallel execution and decentralized computational resources dynamically scale based on network demand, supporting higher efficiency.

title: Efficiency
description: The decentralized execution model reduces costs for developers and dApp users.
details: By sharing computational resources and preventing monopolization, the network offers a cost-effective alternative to traditional centralized execution services.

title: Resilience
description: A robust execution network designed to withstand failures and attacks.
details: Decentralization eliminates single points of failure, ensuring consistent transaction execution even in the presence of malicious actors.

title: Cross-Chain Interoperability
description: Facilitates seamless execution of transactions across different blockchain ecosystems.
details: Executors support interoperability between various chains, including Ethereum, Ethereum L2s, and altVM chains, enabling a more connected multichain environment.
